events.description: Fired when a folder has been created.
events.name: onCreated

events.description: Fired when a folder has been renamed.
events.name: onRenamed

events.description: Fired when a folder has been moved.
events.name: onMoved

events.description: Fired when a folder has been copied.
events.name: onCopied

events.description: Fired when a folder has been deleted.
events.name: onDeleted

events.description: Fired when properties of a folder have changed (<var>specialUse</var> and <var>isFavorite</var>).
events.name: onUpdated

events.description: Fired when certain information of a folder have changed. Bursts of message count changes are collapsed to a single event.
events.name: onFolderInfoChanged

functions.description: Gets folders that match the specified properties, or all folders if no properties are specified.
functions.name: query

accountId.description: Limits the search to folders of the account with the specified id.

canAddMessages.description: Whether the folder supports adding new messages, or not.

canAddSubfolders.description: Whether the folder supports adding new subfolders, or not.

canBeDeleted.description: Whether the folder can be deleted, or not.

canBeRenamed.description: Whether the folder can be renamed, or not.

canDeleteMessages.description: Whether the folder supports deleting messages, or not.

folderId.description: Limits the search to the folder with the specified id.

hasMessages.description: Whether the folder (excluding subfolders) contains messages, or not. Supports to specify a $(ref:folders.QueryRange) (min/max) instead of a simple boolean value (none/some).

hasNewMessages.description: Whether the folder (excluding subfolders) contains new messages, or not. Supports to specify a $(ref:folders.QueryRange) (min/max) instead of a simple boolean value (none/some).

hasSubFolders.description: Whether the folder has subfolders, or not. Supports to specify a $(ref:folders.QueryRange) (min/max) instead of a simple boolean value (none/some).

hasUnreadMessages.description: Whether the folder (excluding subfolders) contains unread messages, or not. Supports to specify a $(ref:folders.QueryRange) (min/max) instead of a simple boolean value (none/some).

isFavorite.description: Whether the folder is a favorite folder, or not.

isRoot.description: Whether the folder is a root folder, or not.

isTag.description: Whether the folder is a virtual tag folder, or not. Note: Virtual tag folders are always skipped, unless this property is set to <var>true</var>

isUnified.description: Whether the folder is a unified mailbox folder, or not. Note: Unified mailbox folders are always skipped, unless this property is set to <var>true</var>

isVirtual.description: Whether the folder is a virtual search folder, or not.

limit.description: Limits the number of returned folders. If used together with <var>recent</var>, supports being set to $(ref:folders.DEFAULT_MOST_RECENT_LIMIT)

name.description: Return only folders whose name is matched by the provided string or regular expression.

path.description: Return only folders whose path is matched by the provided string or regular expression.

recent.description: Whether the folder (excluding subfolders) has been used within the last month, or not. The returned folders will be sorted by their recentness.

specialUse.description: Match only folders with the specified special use (folders have to match all specified uses).

type.description: Deprecated. Match only folders with the specified special use.

parameters.description: Specifies whether the returned $(ref:folders.MailFolder) should populate its <var>subFolders</var> property and include all its (nested!) subfolders. Defaults to <var>true</var>.
parameters.name: includeSubFolders

functions.description: Creates a new subfolder in the specified folder, or at the root of the specified account.
functions.name: create

choices.deprecated: Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.create() requires to specify a MailFolderId instead of a full MailFolder object.
Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.create() requires to specify the MailFolderId of the account's rootFolder, instead of a full MailAccount object.
Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.rename() requires to specify a MailFolderId instead of a full MailFolder object.

functions.description: Moves the given source folder into the given destination folder. Throws if the destination already contains a folder with the name of the source folder.
functions.name: move

choices.deprecated: Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.move() requires to specify a MailFolderId for its source parameter, instead of a full MailFolder object.
Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.move() requires to specify a MailFolderId for its destination parameter, instead of a full MailFolder object.

Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.move() requires to specify the MailFolderId of the account's rootFolder for its destination parameter, instead of a full MailAccount object.

functions.description: Copies the given source folder into the given destination folder. Throws if the destination already contains a folder with the name of the source folder.
functions.name: copy

choices.deprecated: Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.copy() requires to specify a MailFolderId for its source parameter, instead of a full MailFolder object.
Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.copy() requires to specify a MailFolderId for its destination parameter, instead of a full MailFolder object.

Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.copy() requires to specify the MailFolderId of the account's rootFolder for its destination parameter, instead of a full MailAccount object.
Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.delete() requires to specify a MailFolderId instead of a full MailFolder object.
Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.update() requires to specify a MailFolderId instead of a full MailFolder object.

isFavorite.description: Sets or clears the favorite status.

functions.description: Get additional information about a folder.
functions.name: getFolderInfo

choices.deprecated: Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.getFolderInfo() requires to specify a MailFolderId instead of a full MailFolder object.

functions.description: Get capability information about a folder.
functions.name: getFolderCapabilities

choices.deprecated: Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.getFolderCapabilities() requires to specify a MailFolderId instead of a full MailFolder object.

functions.description: Get all parent folders as a flat ordered array. The first array entry is the direct parent.
functions.name: getParentFolders

choices.deprecated: Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.getParentFolders() requires to specify a MailFolderId instead of a full MailFolder object.

parameters.description: Specifies whether each returned parent $(ref:folders.MailFolder) should populate its <var>subFolders</var> property and include all its (nested!) subfolders. Defaults to <var>false</var>.
parameters.name: includeSubFolders

functions.description: Get the subfolders of the specified folder or account.
functions.name: getSubFolders

choices.deprecated: Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.getSubFolders() requires to specify a MailFolderId instead of a full MailFolder object.
Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.getSubFolders() requires to specify the MailFolderId of the account's rootFolder, instead of a full MailAccount object.

parameters.description: Specifies whether each returned direct child $(ref:folders.MailFolder) should populate its <var>subFolders</var> property and include all its (nested!) subfolders. Defaults to <var>true</var>.
parameters.name: includeSubFolders

functions.description: Get one of the special unified mailbox folders, which are virtual search folders and return the content from all mail accounts.
functions.name: getUnifiedFolder

parameters.description: The requested unified mailbox folder type.
parameters.name: type

parameters.description: Specifies whether the returned $(ref:folders.MailFolder) should populate its <var>subFolders</var> property and include all its (nested!) subfolders. Defaults to <var>false</var>.
parameters.name: includeSubFolders

functions.description: Get one of the special unified mailbox tag folders, which are virtual search folders and group messages from all mail accounts based on their tags.
functions.name: getTagFolder

parameters.description: The tag key of the requested folder. See $(ref:messages.tags.list()) for the available tags. Throws when specifying an invalid tag key.
parameters.name: key

functions.description: Marks all messages in a folder as read.
functions.name: markAsRead

choices.deprecated: Support deprecated since Thunderbird 121 and removed in Manifest V3: folders.markAsRead() requires to specify a MailFolderId instead of a full MailFolder object.

DEFAULT_MOST_RECENT_LIMIT.description: The number of most recent folders used in Thunderbird's UI. Controled by the <var>mail.folder_widget.max_recent</var> preference.

accountId.description: The id of the account this folder belongs to.

isFavorite.description: Whether this folder is a favorite folder.

isRoot.description: Whether this folder is a root folder.

isTag.description: Whether this folder is a virtual tag folder.

isUnified.description: Whether this folder is a unified mailbox folder.

isVirtual.description: Whether this folder is a virtual search folder.

name.description: The human-friendly name of this folder.

path.description: Path to this folder in the account. Although paths look predictable, never guess a folder's path, as there are a number of reasons why it may not be what you think it is. Use $(ref:folders.getParentFolders) or $(ref:folders.getSubFolders) to obtain hierarchy information.

specialUse.description: The special use of this folder. A folder can have multiple special uses.

subFolders.description: Subfolders of this folder. The property may be <var>null</var>, if inclusion of folders had not been requested. The folders will be returned in the same order as used in Thunderbird's folder pane.

type.description: Deprecated. Was used to represent the type of this folder.

types.description: A unique id representing a $(ref:folders.MailFolder) throughout a session. Renaming or moving a folder will invalidate its id.
An object containing additional information about a folder.

favorite.description: Deprecated. This information is now available in $(ref:folders.MailFolder).

lastUsed.description: Date the folder was last used (precision: seconds).

newMessageCount.description: Number of new messages in this folder.

totalMessageCount.description: Number of messages in this folder.

unreadMessageCount.description: Number of unread messages in this folder.

types.description: An object containing capability information about a folder.

canAddMessages.description: Whether this folder supports adding new messages.

canAddSubfolders.description: Whether this folder supports adding new subfolders.

canBeDeleted.description: Whether this folder can be deleted.

canBeRenamed.description: Whether this folder can be renamed.

canDeleteMessages.description: Whether this folder supports deleting messages.

types.description: Supported values for the special use of a folder.

type.description: The type of the quota as defined by RFC2087. A <var>STORAGE</var> quota is constraining the available storage in bytes, a <var>MESSAGE</var> quota is constraining the number of storable messages.

max.description: The maximum value required to match the query.

min.description: The minimum value required to match the query.

flags.description: Supported RegExp flags: <var>i</var> = case insensitive, and/or one of <var>u</var> = unicode support or <var>v</var> = extended unicode support
